Search term
## Search Stanford:
Web People
Other ways to search: [Map](https://campus-map.stanford.edu/) [Profiles](https://profiles.stanford.edu/)
## Main Content
# Admission
Explore the possibilities of a Stanford education.
![A student wearing the Tree mascot costume stands in the middle of Stanford Stadium](https://www.stanford.edu/admission/)
* * *
**7,554** Undergraduate students  **Class of 2028** from 70 countries + 50 states  **9,915** Graduate students 
* * *
## Undergraduates
### Undergraduate Admission
About 1,700 freshmen and 30 transfer students enroll at Stanford each year. We review each applicant with an eye to academic excellence, intellectual vitality, and personal context.
[Undergraduate Admission](http://admission.stanford.edu/)
### Undergraduate Financial Aid
Stanford meets the full financial need of every admitted undergrad who qualifies for assistance. Tuition is covered for undergrads with family incomes under $150,000. Tuition, room, and board are covered for undergrads with family incomes below $100,000.
[Undergraduate Financial Aid](http://admission.stanford.edu/afford/)
### Profile of the Class of 2028
[Class of 2028](http://facts.stanford.edu/academics/freshmen-class-profile)
![A new Stanford student smiles from the audience at a Convocation ceremony.](https://www.stanford.edu/admission/)
## Graduate Studies
![](https://www.stanford.edu/admission/)
### Graduate Admission
About 150 degree programs are offered across seven schools at Stanford. Admission requirements vary greatly among them.
[Graduate Admissions](http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/)
### Financing Graduate Study
The cost of graduate study at Stanford — and the resources available for financial support — vary by degree, school and enrollment status. About 85% of Stanford graduate students receive financial assistance.
[Graduate Student Funding](https://vpge.stanford.edu/fellowships-funding/graduate-student-funding)
### Vice Provost for Graduate Education
The Office of the Vice Provost for Graduate Education offers information for prospective students of the graduate degree programs offered at Stanford.
[Information for Prospective Students](https://vpge.stanford.edu/gateways/prospective-students)
## Financial Aid
We are committed to making a world-class education affordable.
**72%** of students receive financial aid toward the cost of attendance  **Tuition covered** for undergrads with family incomes below $150,000  **Tuition, room, & board covered** for undergrads with family incomes below $100,000  **Graduate aid available** based on available funds and academic merit 
[More About Financial Aid](https://financialaid.stanford.edu/)
## Applying To Other Programs
### Summer Session
High school students, current Stanford students, and other college students can all apply to participate in eight-week summer academic programs.
[Summer Session](http://summer.stanford.edu/)
### Lifelong Learning
Stanford offers valuable opportunities in continuing adult education, executive, and professional programs, and special programs for K-12 students.
[Lifelong Learning Programs](https://lifelonglearning.stanford.edu/)
### Postdocs
Information for postdoctoral scholars seeking positions at Stanford University.
[Postdoctoral Positions](https://postdocs.stanford.edu/prospective-postdocs)
![](https://www.stanford.edu/admission/)
